title: TFT Ranked - What are we doing for Set 2 Rise of the Elements?
body:
Hey Tacticians!

With Rise of the Elements now out in the wild, and our first patch coming to a close, we wanted to highlight what you should expect from the next Teamfight Tactics ranked split when it kicks back off this week on patch 9.23. There’s three main things we wanted to cover:

* We'll be _**hard**_ resetting everyone’s **rank **down to Iron.
* We'll be _**soft**_ resetting everyone’s _**MMR**_. 
* _**Never**_ losing LP for coming _**4th**_

**Why a hard rank reset? **

For many of you, we know that progressing through the ladder as you master a game can be an incredibly satisfying period of time. We want to see if we can offer that entirely fresh ranked experience each time we release a new set. Given that we’ve introduced almost entirely new champions, spells, and strategies, we feel now is a good time to go for a big change, and gather feedback from players to see how it feels to inform future set releases. It’s worth noting that during placements - the first 5 ranked games you play on 9.23, you will not lose any LP regardless of how low you place so the sky's the limit if you win all 5!

**Why a soft MMR reset?**

While everyone kicking off their ranked split from the same rank is exciting, we still want the games at the start of the season to feel competitive and fair. We don't want someone totally new to ranked ending up in a game with all of you former challenger players, just like we don't want a challenger player finding themselves in a lobby with a bunch of players in Iron (and me). Since we’d changed SO much about the game however, we went with a soft reset to reflect the learning process we are all going through while maintaining the competitive nature of the queue. That being said, players who were high MMR in Set 1 can expect that they’ll progress through the ranks faster than those who were lower MMR. While we want your first games to be competitive, we also didn’t want it to feel like you were punished for doing well during set 1. 

**Never losing LP for coming 4th**

One clear pain point from Set 1 that many of you brought to our attention was that it felt really bad to place 4th in a game, thinking you “won”, only to end up losing LP. These instances were rare, but when they happened they really felt shitty, so we wanted to make some improvements. In set 2, 4th place will now never result in an LP loss, but 5th place always will. We hope that this makes games where you make it to the top 4 feel more exciting, helps change the mindset that the only way to win is to come 1st, and it allows us to add some additional in game ceremony to help recognize your placement.

We’re super excited to watch you figure out the new strategies available in Rise of the Elements over the coming months! Please continue to give us feedback, it helped us build Rise of the Elements knowing confidently that we were moving in the right direction. You can read up on some of the other larger changes we've made [here](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2019/10/dev-tft-set-1-learnings/).

Sooo... 
Consider a senario like this :

A Master player with Master MMR gets placed in a Master/GM MMR lobbies in all his placements and unfortunately lose all 5 of it, So he gets placed on iron after placements (since its a hard rank reset).
Even though he is Iron he'll continue to play on Master MMR lobbies since its "Soft MMR reset" and struggle to climb from iron coz in my experience one cannot keep a long winstreak on high elos(High diamond onwards). 

Correct me if im wrong but does any of this sounds fair to u???? Specially the Master player who gets placed on Iron?

LP gains are calculated based on MMR gap between your mmr and the average mmr of your rank.

Therefore if your have Master tier mmr but Iron rank you will gain way more lp than you lose, becaues the average MMR of Iron is way lower than your hidden MMR and the system knows you shouldn't be in this rank. So it gives you more lp, so that average MMR of the rank youre in, is closer to your actual MMR.

Please for the sake of people who play TFT a LOT, please reward us with something more significant then an emote if you reach higher ranks. Or just a better reward. It makes playing TFT ranked feel underwhelming knowing you're just getting a half baked emote, even if you manage to get plat or even diamond plus. Getting anything above gold really doesnt matter.
"you're diamond in tft? all you got was a shitty emote LOL!" - literally all my friends

They have literally said that they are working on another more meaningful reward. It was right in the text they showed when they announced the Emote. It said, they hadn't finalized it yet but everyone will get their correct ones once it is ready.

I mean the reward is knowing u are better then everyone below you. Don't need a reward any massive reward just because you played 10 games to get from gold-plat maybe GM's should get a massive reward but thats about it

If you think it took 10 games then you have no idea what your talking about. I didn't take the placement matches seriously so started iron 2. To get up to plat it took 150 plus games placing 3rd or 4th like 70% of the time. I had 9 First place matches of those games the rest 2nd - 4th and those were i lost LP my point is its not some fast thing to do.
Better rng you mean
not asking for a massive reward, just something a little more meaningful. like what, am i suppose to flash my emote all day? i'll probably stop using it after a few games..

I mean, yes? It's what we're going to see now with the Honor Rewards as those went from being Ward Skins into Emotes this year. So, we're going to see people flashing all the Honor emotes (cause that's sooooooooooooo honorable)

I was plat in S1. Now, I'll have to beat other people who were in plat in S1 order to get out of Bronze in S2. How the hell does that make sense? How is that not punishing me for doing well last season? And why miss-lead about progressing faster? Anyone higher ranked may earn more LP per victory, but the soft reset means they will have fewer victories than if there was a hard reset or MMR, so you are progressing at the same rate.

Soft reset of one and hard reset of the other introduces a disconnect between a players mastery of the game and their visible rank until they have played a large number of matches. Those matches aren't fun, it doesn't capture the feel of progressing again, it feels more like spending 8 hours in a single player game then having to start over because the power went out and you forgot to save.

Unfortunately thats exactly what RIOT expects us to do imo. Since TFT is new to League, they want players to spend alot of time in it.

So do LP gains reflect the actual MMR?

If it works like the base game, yes, but imperfectly. Or rather, it reflects the *difference* between your Rank and your MMR. In the base game, if your Rank is lower than what it "should" be for your current MMR, your LP gains are increased.
